title: How to Have a Teen or Adult Spa Party at Home for Cheap

steps.headline: Select how many people you want to invite.
steps.description: Remember to keep it small (2-6 people depending on the size of your house and bathroom.)

steps.headline: Get some invites.
steps.description: You can get them for free online at www.evite.com. They have some great selections for a spa themed party.

steps.headline: Set up one room as a changing room, not the bathroom you're using though.
steps.description: You can use one room for everyone. just hang up some white sheets in the room.

steps.headline: Set up a lounge room for everyone to hang out in before treatments.
Set up your bathroom with candles and soothing music.
steps.description: This can be bought for cheap in a store or use a radio on classical music or use your computer and look online for free sounds.

steps.headline: After that is all done, have stations set up.
steps.description: You might want five stations like pedicure, manicure, facials, massage,and hair + make up

steps.headline: During lounging, use an herbal neck wrap.
steps.description: Just jet a tube sock fill it with rice or those itsy bitsy rocks and lavender or rosemary sprigs then sew it together or tie the top in a tight knot and heat in a microwave for two -three minutes.

steps.headline: After all of this you can save up your money for a night on the town or a shopping night!
For a fun way to end the party just make sure your husband or parents are out of the way and sleep over.
Serve some healthy and delicious snacks.
steps.description: Concentrate on the spa experience and choose foods that are considered to be "feel good" foods. Serve fresh fruit with a chocolate dip or cream cheese dip, a vegetable tray with ranch dip and maybe some creme-filled eclairs. Flavored water or just water with cucumber slices!

steps.headline: Booth 1: Wash hair with egg shampoo and wrap in a towel.
steps.description: To make egg shampoo, mix all the ingredients listed above and be sure to rinse thoroughly after shampooing. This booth should be near the kitchen sink so that each tween can have her hair shampooed by another tween. You can use regular shampoo instead of messing with the egg shampoo. Leave the towels draped around their hair like a turban wrap until Booth 5.

steps.headline: Booth 2: Have facials just like at the spa.
steps.description: You can buy individual face masks in trial sizes in most department stores or drugstores. The girls can cleanse their own faces with warm water before being given the rest of the facial by one of the other teens. Leave the facial masks on for about 10 minutes or so, then rinse. Finish by dabbing on toner with cotton balls.

steps.headline: Booth 3: Create a manicure area.
steps.description: You'll need two bowls of water, one warm and one cold. In the warm water, add some nice-smelling liquid soap or even shampoo. Leave the cold for rinsing their hands after soaking in the warm solution. The tween should soak her hands for just a few minutes, rinse and then blot them dry with a hand towel. Gather as many nail polishes as you can, and nail painting will finish this spa experience.

steps.headline: Booth 4: Offer a relaxing foot soak.
steps.description: When the timer buzzes, after each rotation, the tub should be emptied, and a fresh soak should be made of warm water and either salt or vinegar. Add about a tablespoon of salt to the water or use half vinegar and half water.

steps.headline: Booth 5: Dry hair and style.
steps.description: Tween girls love to do each other's hair, so make sure to have a hot iron and hair dryer handy at this spa station. You can also gather hairpins and barrettes for them to use. If you like, let them apply makeup on each other; however, it will be getting close to bedtime, so you may want to hold off on the makeup.

text: Steps Set aside three tidy rooms. (One of them your bathroom). Select how many people you want to invite. Remember to keep it small (2-6 people depending on the size of your house and bathroom.) Get some invites. You can get them for free online at www.evite.com. They have some great selections for a spa themed party. Set up one room as a changing room, not the bathroom you're using though. You can use one room for everyone. just hang up some white sheets in the room. Set up a lounge room for everyone to hang out in before treatments.  Set up your bathroom with candles and soothing music. This can be bought for cheap in a store or use a radio on classical music or use your computer and look online for free sounds. After that is all done, have stations set up. You might want five stations like pedicure, manicure, facials, massage,and hair + make up During lounging, use an herbal neck wrap. Just jet a tube sock fill it with rice or those itsy bitsy rocks and lavender or rosemary sprigs then sew it together or tie the top in a tight knot and heat in a microwave for two -three minutes. After all of this you can save up your money for a night on the town or a shopping night! After you're all dolled up. For a fun way to end the party just make sure your husband or parents are out of the way and sleep over.  Serve some healthy and delicious snacks. Concentrate on the spa experience and choose foods that are considered to be "feel good" foods. Serve fresh fruit with a chocolate dip or cream cheese dip, a vegetable tray with ranch dip and maybe some creme-filled eclairs. Flavored water or just water with cucumber slices! Set Up Your Spa Stations Booth 1: Wash hair with egg shampoo and wrap in a towel. To make egg shampoo, mix all the ingredients listed above and be sure to rinse thoroughly after shampooing. This booth should be near the kitchen sink so that each tween can have her hair shampooed by another tween. You can use regular shampoo instead of messing with the egg shampoo. Leave the towels draped around their hair like a turban wrap until Booth 5. Booth 2: Have facials just like at the spa. You can buy individual face masks in trial sizes in most department stores or drugstores. The girls can cleanse their own faces with warm water before being given the rest of the facial by one of the other teens. Leave the facial masks on for about 10 minutes or so, then rinse. Finish by dabbing on toner with cotton balls. Booth 3: Create a manicure area. You'll need two bowls of water, one warm and one cold. In the warm water, add some nice-smelling liquid soap or even shampoo. Leave the cold for rinsing their hands after soaking in the warm solution. The tween should soak her hands for just a few minutes, rinse and then blot them dry with a hand towel. Gather as many nail polishes as you can, and nail painting will finish this spa experience. Booth 4: Offer a relaxing foot soak. When the timer buzzes, after each rotation, the tub should be emptied, and a fresh soak should be made of warm water and either salt or vinegar. Add about a tablespoon of salt to the water or use half vinegar and half water. Booth 5: Dry hair and style. Tween girls love to do each other's hair, so make sure to have a hot iron and hair dryer handy at this spa station. You can also gather hairpins and barrettes for them to use. If you like, let them apply makeup on each other; however, it will be getting close to bedtime, so you may want to hold off on the makeup.
